page.title: 20Rode Tropical Bird Gardens.
page.content:
Rode lies between two main roads, the A361 and the A36, and is not the traditional picture postcard village it would not normally be visited by tourists. However many thousands of people come every year to the Tropical Bird Gardens. These lie just outside the village on the road to Bath. They are famous throughout Britain, particularly for a cockatoo which starred for many years on a children's television animal programme. Many of the birds fly freely in the gardens and the brightly coloured macaws can often be seen flying over the village, a spectacular sight.
This report has been prepared by 10 members of Rode Womens Institute as part of the commemoration of our 65th anniversary. We have learned much about our area as a result.
